fixed QR code sharing out, users scan the QR code can automatically generate a temporary account, login, temporary account does not support recovery, default to a circle to support up to 20 temporary accounts.

*Select to re-join a circle or scan to join a new one.

To log in to your registered account, please scan your configuration QR code or import it from your \'photos\'.

Want to switch to another device with your account synchronised? Export the configuration QR code for quick login.
 1. Go to 'My', find 'Settings'
 2. Export the configuration QR code.
QR code has been activated by other users.
Are you sure you want to delete the user?
contacts in the group at once.
Users have reached the upper limit
Anyone with your Circle QR Code can create accounts in your Confidant Station without your permission.
Save it in the draft box?
Sent from MyConfidant, the app for encrypted email.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on
 1. On your computer, open QQ Mailbox.
 2. In the top right, click Settings.
 3. In the “Start Service” section, select Enable
 IMAP/SMTP.
 4. Click Save Changes.
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on
 1. On your computer, open QQ Mail.
 2. In the top right, click Settings.
 3. Find POP3/IMAP/SMTP/Exchange/CardDAV/CalDAV.
 4. Enable IMAP/SMTP.
 
 Step B: Get authorization to log in the third-party Email client
 1. Generate authorization code.
 2. Check the SMS message sent by QQ Mail.
 3. Fill in the authorization code.
 
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on 
 1. On your computer, open 163 Mail.
 2. In the top right, click Settings.
 3. Click Settings.
 4. Click POP3/SMTP/IMAP tab.
 5. In the POP3/SMTP/IMAP setting section, select Enable IMAP/SMTP.
 6. Click Save Changes.
 
 Step B: Get authorization to log in the third-party Email client
 1. Pass security verification. 
 2. Set up authorization code. 
 3. Click Confirm. 
 
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on 
 1. On your computer, open Gmail. 
 2. In the top right, click Settings. 
 3. Click Settings. 
 4. Click the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab. 
 5. In the "IMAP access" section, select Enable IMAP. 
 6. Click Save Changes. 
 
 Step B: Allow less secure apps 
 1. In the top right, click Account. 
 2. Click Security in the left bar. 
 3. Turn on Less secure app access. 
 4. Open the alert email sent by Google. 
 5. Confirm the turn on activity. 
 
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on 
 1. On your computer, open Outlook、Hotmail、live. 
 2. In the top right, click Settings. 
 3. In the “Start Service” section, select Enable IMAP/SMTP. 
 4. Click Save Changes. 
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.

Step A: Check that IMAP is turned on 
 1. On your computer, open Outlook、Hotmail、live. 
 2. In the top right, click Settings. 
 3. In the “Start Service” section, select Enable IMAP/SMTP. 
 4. Click Save Changes. 
 Then enter your Email address and password to log in.
